action.action-desc: Ms. Velázquez (for herself, Mr. Espaillat, Mr. Torres of New York, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, and Mr. Case) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To provide exemptions from certain Jones Act restrictions to vessels providing disaster relief to Puerto Rico for the areas affected by Hurricane Fiona.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Puerto Rico Recovery Act.

section.header: Temporary exemptions from Jones Act restrictions for vessels providing hurricane relief to Puerto Rico

subsection.header: Temporary exemption for Puerto Rican hurricane relief

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding sections 12112, 12103, and 55102 of title 46, United States Code, the Secretary of the department in which the Coast Guard is operating (referred to in this section as the Secretary) shall exempt a vessel from the requirements of such sections if the Secretary determines that the owner or operator of the vessel has reasonably demonstrated that the exemption is needed to provide disaster relief to Puerto Rico for areas affected by Hurricane Fiona.

subparagraph.text: An owner or operator of a vessel may request an exemption under paragraph (1), and the Secretary shall approve or deny the request by not later than 72 hours after the request is made.

In any case where the Secretary denies an exemption request under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall promptly provide a public, detailed statement regarding the reasoning and analysis for the denial.
If the Secretary does not approve or deny a request according to the terms of subparagraph (A), the request shall be deemed to be approved.

subsection.text: An exemption approved under subsection (a) shall be valid until the earlier of—

paragraph.text: the date that is 1 year after the date on which the exemption was approved; or
the date on which the major disaster declared by the President under section 401 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5121) on September 22, 2022 expires.

subsection.text: This section, and any exemption issued under this section, shall cease to have effect on the date described in subsection (b)(2).
